hedline.hl1: Neediest Cases Fund Breaks a Record

block.p: Contributions to The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund rose past the $5.1 million mark yesterday, breaking a record set in 1991-92 and making this the most successful campaign since the fund was established in 1912.

Contributions to The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund rose past the $5.1 million mark yesterday, breaking a record set in 1991-92 and making this the most successful campaign since the fund was established in 1912.

Although most donations range from $25 to $50, the fund has gained an unexpected windfall from trusts and estates that name it as a beneficiary. Over $350,000 has been received from estates and trusts this year, more than twice as much as last year.
